lead_paragraph: Lloyds, the biggest British retail bank that was partially nationalized during the credit crisis, said it was set for decent 2010 results as bad debts fell and margins continued to improve, Reuters reported.
snippet: Lloyds, Britain's biggest retail bank which was part-nationalized during the credit crisis, said it was set for decent 2010 results as bad debts fall and margins continue to improve.

headline.main: Lloyds Expects Good 2010 Results as Margins Improve

abstract: Lloyds, Britain's biggest retail bank which was part-nationalized during the credit crisis, said it was set for decent 2010 results as bad debts fall and margins continue to improve.
